author: mearaftadewos
title: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia
description: In Ethiopia, people can't buy or cash out ADA easily. There is also no ADA payment ways and cardano users in Ethiopia, only few in Africa

assessments.note: I think this is a number1 when growing Cardano adaptations in Africa, achieved by a community.
The plan they have laid out would be beneficial to both the Ethiopian people and the Cardano community, helping them both expand in an organic way.

Difficult to assess fully given the lack of information and lack of fully described plan and budget. I also note that the author raised concerns with the community that were not fully addressed. This proposal may benefit from ongoing discussions with community members for further consideration in subsequent funding rounds.

The is always a requirement for a local facility to fiat out crypto. This improves adoption of crypto. The proposal aims to field a local money exchange in ADA with in the government regulations. This will improve the adoption and liquidity of ADA in a substantial manner.

Challenges mentioned are inability to trade ADA to local currency in Ethiopia and payment system which can transact in ADA.

Proposal only tackle one issue which is an Exchange to convert ADA to local currency.

The other challenge which to pay and transact using ADA is not clearly mentioned.

The plan is relatively simple, however there is are a lot of complexities from a regulatory standpoint in physical ADA to FIAT. The proposers have listed "Key Connections" as relevant experience. It is impossible to judge this and thus whether the proposal will be implemented successfully.
Experience and skills seem to be eligible. More proof would be nice to have.

The team has not included any links to their prior experience in this proposal, however, I have noticed that they have proposed several projects together in this fund, where they have included some more info regarding that. The plan they've presented is coherent, to the point and it seems to me that it can be implemented successfully.
Some useful experience evident although many concerns with legality and risks that still need to be tackled. Proposal needs further refinement before it can be fully assessed.
The proposal is simple and aims to provide a transparent government-approved exchange service, This has minimal risks, so the proposers will be able to implement the proposal.

Initially proposer is working on this project alone until he invited two others to jump in.

Project can be implemented successfully on the first idea, a place where locals can buy or sell ADA in their local currency. The second objective which had not been mentioned the implementation plan is doubtful.
More information on how the proposers are equipped to deal with any potential regulatory issues in the proposal would be useful
Some metrics are not measurable, most of them are. Good proposal overall.

This proposal tackles a subject that could bring a lot of attention to the Cardano ecosystem, either in a positive light or in a negative one if it does not succeed, for a reason or another. Transparency, scrutiny and as much information as possible beforehand is crucial. While the plan is explicit, it doesn't get into as many details as I would have hoped, especially considering their proposal. The fact that they ask for a small budget, that would only cover the first 6 months until they would get their business going, does alleviate some of the concerns.

Reasonable concept but lacking in detail and therefore very difficult to gauge likelihood of success until further information provided by team. I feel its important for the legal and risk aspects to be bedded down before further assessment can be defined.
The budgetary estimates are conservative with a clear task list. The project is proposing a simple auditable process. It will be simple to audit the progress and measure the success of the proposal.
Proposer had already list the success measurement. It is an objective oriented and can be measured easily during the audit in the future.

solution: A service where people can buy and cash out ADA in local currency to enjoy thier investment returns and pay with thier ADA.
experience:
Full-Stack Dev. Mobile App Eng.

Tested Plutus play ground.

A degree in Computer Science.

4 years.

Key connections.
